title: Leicester told Claudio Ranieri he was sacked 'in side room at East Midlands Airport hotel' - Mirror Online
text:
Leicester told Claudio Ranieri he was sacked 'in side room at East Midlands Airport hotel' The Foxes parted company with their title-winning boss after slumping into a tense Premier League relegation battle Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Can you believe this? Claudio Ranieri reportedly found out that he was sacked as Leicester boss in a side room at an airport hotel. 
The Italian's tenure with the Foxes was brought to an end on Thursday after a disappointing string of results. 
Leicester could be bottom of the Premier League before they face Liverpool on Monday night and Ranieri was pulled to one side at the Radisson Blu East Midlands Airport hotel. 
Ranieri was reportedly told that he had lost his job up the team's return from Sevilla following the 2-1 defeat. 
Ranieri was allowed to take charge of the club's first-ever Champions League knockout round game on Wednesday but his fate had already been sealed. The hotel where Ranieri found out his fate (Photo: Google Maps) Ranieri's final game in charge came at Sevilla in the Champions League (Photo: PA) Read More Gary Lineker reveals he CRIED over Claudio Ranieri sacking 
It is reported that the 2-0 defeat to Swansea in the Premier League a fortnight earlier - just days after he received a vote of confidence - was the final straw. 
The Daily Mail report that owner Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha and his son, vice-chairman Aiyawatt, decided against travelling back from Spain with the team. 
Ranieri is said to have soon realised why and was expecting the news upon his return to England. 
Weather problems caused by Storm Doris are said to have made for a bumpy landing and when the plane's cargo hold wouldn't open, the team waited at the hotel nearby. Ranieri was sacked just months after lifting the Premier League trophy (Photo: Michael Regan) 
It was there that Ranieri was allegedly told by director of football Jon Rudkin that he was being removed from his position. 
Ranieri is ready to receive a £3million pay-off after being axed just six months into a new four-year contract. 
The sacking comes nine months after the Italian defied 5000/1 odds to guide the Foxes to a shock title success. 
Ranieri was rewarded with a bumper new double-your-money deal in August that earned him £3m-a-year, and Mirror Sport understands the 65-year-old is in line to receive 12 months' money as part of his severance package. Read More John Terry "gutted" for former manager and "great friend" Claudio Ranieri following sacking Ranieri is in line for a substantial pay-off (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Meanwhile, the sacked manager claims the Foxes have destroyed his dream of staying at the club for life. 
In an incredibly heartfelt and emotional statement, Ranieri said his “dream died” after being sacked as Leicester manager following a dressing room revolt. 
Ranieri described last season’s title success as “the greatest story in football” as Leicester defied odds of 5,000/1 to win the Premier League. 
Former Leicester boss Ranieri even thanked the players who had ultimately got him the sack by complaining to the club’s Thai owners. Read More https://www.instagram.com/p/BQ6JkKvDNAE/?taken-by=kasperschmeichel/embed 
Ranieri said: “Yesterday my dream died. After the euphoria of last season and being crowned Premier League Champions all I dreamt of was staying with Leicester City, the Club I love, for always. Sadly this was not to be. 
“I wish to thank my wife Rosanna and all my family for their never ending support during my time at Leicester. My thanks go to Paolo and Andrea who accompanied me on this wonderful journey. 
“Mostly I have to thank Leicester City Football Club. The adventure was amazing and will live with me forever. Thank you to all the journalists and the media who came with us and enjoyed reporting on the greatest story in football.
